title: Blinding dust storm in Illinois leads to 'multiple fatalities,' dozens hospitalized after highway pileups
description: A blinding dust storm is responsible for pileups on Interstate 55 in rural Illinois that led to "multiple fatalities" and more than 30 people being hospitalized on Monday, officials said.

title: Treasury says U.S. will default on its debt as early as June 1, sooner than expected
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Monday that the deadline to extend the debt ceiling or face the first U.S. default could be as early as June 1.

title: Grieving father recalls Texas mass shooting as the hunt for the suspect continues
description: Wilson Garcia, who lost his wife and eldest son in the attack, recalls the fatal mass shooting and describes how he’d previously known the suspect.

title: U.S. military is tracking another mysterious balloon
description: The U.S. military is tracking a mysterious balloon that flew over American soil, but it’s not clear what it is or whom it belongs to, according to three U.S. officials.

title: Trump's defense grills E. Jean Carroll on old social media posts in rape allegation trial
description: Former President Donald Trump's defense lawyer Joe Tacopina cross-examined writer E. Jean Carroll in the trial over her rape allegation against Trump.

title: FAA sued over SpaceX Starship launch program following April explosion
description: Five environmental and cultural heritage groups are suing the Federal Aviation Administration, alleging that the agency violated the National Environment Policy Act when it allowed SpaceX to launch the largest rocket ever built from its Boca Chica, Texas facility without a comprehensive environmental review, according to court filings obtained by CNBC.

title: Artificial intelligence pioneer leaves Google and warns about technology's future
description: The "godfather of AI" is issuing a warning about the technology he helped create.

title: May snowstorm for the record books blankets parts of Wisconsin and Michigan
description: A record-setting May snowstorm is in the making, which could bring historic snow totals to parts of Wisconsin and the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.

title: Trump's lawyer seeks a mistrial in E. Jean Carroll's rape allegation case, claiming 'prejudicial rulings'
description: A lawyer for former President Donald Trump seeks a mistrial in writer E. Jean Carroll’s rape allegation lawsuit, claiming the judge made "prejudicial rulings."

title: White House digs in on debt strategy after House Republicans' passage of their plan
description: The White House is refining its debt ceiling strategy, ramping up attacks on GOP lawmakers while maintaining there are still no plans for Biden to meet McCarthy.

title: The chronically online third culture is redefining Asian America
description: It’s a new era in Asian America, and the TikTok generation is running it.

title: Why China’s man for peace in Ukraine might be the 'best possible choice' for Russia
description: Li Hui, China's peace envoy to Ukraine, has close ties to Russia. President Xi Jinping is sending him to Europe to try and bring Moscow and Kyiv to the negotiating table.

title: First Republic is seized by regulators and sold to JPMorgan in third major bank failure of 2023
description: First Republic Bank has been taken over by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and will be sold to JPMorgan — the third major bank to go under in less than two months.

title: Troubled teenage relationships can have lasting health consequences, new research finds
description: Teen caught in toxic, controlling dating relationships may be at risk for a variety of problems later, including drug use, risky sex behavior and health struggles.
